UCS ICM: TDI # 206   

Clinical Review Date: 9/24/19

MCG ORG/GRG/InterQual Subset, i.e., name and number: 
Ventricular Arrhythmias
ORG: M-575 (ISC) 

Clinical Indications Met:
 ?Admission for ventricular arrhythmia is indicated for 1 or more of the following(1)(2)(3)(4)(5)(6)(7):Resuscitated or aborted ventricular fibrillation or ventricular tachycardia in patient without implantable cardioverter-defibrillator
Newly recognized (eg, new diagnosis for patient) sustained (30 seconds or more of ventricular rhythm at more than 100 beats per minute) ventricular tachycardia
Respiratory distress (eg, dyspnea, Tachypnea)
 Hypoxemia
Suspected cardiac ischemia[B] as cause or consequence of arrhythmia

Cat/RPM if not previously documented: N

Pertinent Member-Specific Clinical: 
58 y/o,  with HX antitrypsin deficiency went into
cardiac arrest, Ventricular tachycardia which shopping at Kroger's
CPR, ACLS protocol, intubated on vent, 
Resp acidosis
Solu-Medrol IV, 
Linezolid IV, Zithromax IV.
BNP 5847
PH 7.0
PO2 343 high

Aztreonam IV, 
9/24  to attempt weaning, pO2 141.0,

Level of Care
LOC ADVERSE DECISIONS ALLOWED FOR MEDICAL CASES ONLY 
RETROSPECTIVE ADVERSE DECISIONS CAN BE RENDERED AND COMMUNICATED ONLY IN THE SITUATIONS AS OUTLINE BELOW: ADVERSE DECISIONS ALLOWED FOR ALL DAYS AND CAN BE RENDERED AND COMMUNICATED RETROSPECTIVELY WHEN NOTIFICATION IS UNTIMELY. ADVERSE DECISIONS FOR DAYS ON/PRIOR TO NOTIFICATION DATE CAN BE RENDERED/COMMUNICATED RETROSPECTIVELY WHEN NO PA IS REQUIRED.  ICM MUST COMPLETE REVIEW WITHIN 1 BUSINESS DAY OF NOTIFICATION DATE. POST DISCHARGE REVIEW FOR ADVERSE DECISIONS CAN BE RENDERED/COMMUNICATED RETROSPECTIVELY FOR SHORT STAYS WITH TIMELY NOTIFICATION ONLY IF D/C WITHIN 1 BUSINESS DAY OF ADMISSION NOTIFICATION DATES.
